com.apigee.flow.execution

Interface ExecutionContext


  • public interface ExecutionContext

    The ExecutionContext class provides hooks that let you query the current flow and submit or schedule aysnchronous Runnable tasks.

    Example: Submit a task that executes asynchronously.

    public class JavaSubmitTask implements Execution {


    public ExecutionResult execute(final MessageContext messageContext, final ExecutionContext executionContext) {
        try {
            executionContext.submitTask(new Task());
            // Here onwards, the proxy flow continues and can return 
            // either success or failure in the case of an error. 
            return ExecutionResult.SUCCESS;
        } catch (Exception e) {
            return ExecutionResult.ABORT;
        }
    }

    private static class Task implements Runnable {

        public void run() {
            // Perform a task asynchronously that does not 
            // interact or influence the proxy flow. 

        }
    }
}

    Example: Submit a task with a callback.

    public class JavaSubmitTaskCallback implements Execution {


    public ExecutionResult execute(MessageContext messageContext, ExecutionContext executionContext) {
        Message message = messageContext.getMessage();
        // Any synchronous/blocking code goes here. 
        // ...
        executionContext.submitTask(new AuthenticationTask(), new PostAuthenticationCallback(), executionContext);
        // This line resumes after the submitTask is done.
        //...
        return ExecutionResult.PAUSE; // causes the flow to pause until resumed explicitly again
    }

    class AuthenticationTask implements Runnable {
        String subject = "FOOBAR";

        @Override
        public void run() {
            // Do long running task.
        }

        public String getSubject() {
            return subject;
        }
    }

    class PostAuthenticationCallback implements Callback {

        /**
         * Post this method invocation, resume of flow is invoked by the framework
         */
        public void callback(Runnable task, Object handback) {
            AuthenticationTask authTask = (AuthenticationTask) task;
            String subject = task.getSubject();
        }
    }
}

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isErrorFlow() 
      Tests if the current proxy flow context is the error flow.
      boolean isRequestFlow() 
      Tests if the current proxy flow context is the request flow.
      void resume() 
      Resumes a paused execution.
      void scheduleTask(java.lang.Runnable task, long delay, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit) 
      Schedules a runnable task.
      void submitTask(java.lang.Runnable task) 
      Submits a runnable task.
      void submitTask(java.lang.Runnable task, Callback callback, java.lang.Object handback) 
      Submits a runnable task and calls a callback when the task completes.

    • Method Detail

      • isRequestFlow

        boolean isRequestFlow()
        Tests if the current proxy flow context is the request flow.
        Returns:
        true if the proxy is executing in the request flow.

      • isErrorFlow

        boolean isErrorFlow()
        Tests if the current proxy flow context is the error flow.
        Returns:
        true, if the proxy is executing in the error flow.

      • submitTask

        void submitTask(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Submits a runnable task.
        Parameters:
        task - Runnable that is executed in a different thread.

      • scheduleTask

        void scheduleTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                  long delay,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Schedules a runnable task.
        Parameters:
        task - Runnable that is executed in a different thread.
        delay - Amount of time to delay the task. Units are specified by the timeUnit parameter.
        timeUnit - Specifies how the delay should be interpreted. For example: TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS.

      • submitTask

        void submitTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                Callback callback,
                java.lang.Object handback)
        Submits a runnable task and calls a callback when the task completes.
        Parameters:
        task - Runnable that is executed in a different thread.
        callback - After the task executes, the proxy flow resumes and invokes the callback() method on this interface.
        handback - An object that allows you to exchange context information between the task and the callback.

      • resume

        void resume()
        Resumes a paused execution.
